page.title: 08HEALTH
page.content: BLOCK D SQ. 3 The local Nursing officer advises that the factories in the area are subject toe Factories Act 1948-61.Their waste must be cleaned before emission.Only sand and grit are considered safe.All the larger factories have an Occupational Health Nurse for the benefit of the employees. A Factory Environmental Health Officer is employed by Wolverhampton Borough Council and based at the Civic Centre in Wolverhampton. The people of the area are served by a doctor in Neachells Lane or the Health Centre in Alfred Squire Road.This also provides dental treatment and operates a chiropody service for the elderly or handicapped. Several of the old people interviewed had lived in the same house for more than fifty years.
